column4: Is it possible to chown a file to a user and a group that user isn't a part of?
that question makes little to no sense

let me rephrase it. I have a file chmodded to 0750. The user is derp. The group is the same group that PHP-FastCGI runs under. Derp is not part of that group. Is that allowed, or will it cause complications?
if you set strange ownership privileges, ubuntu is not going to question you.
